player: Mike Scott did not play in the D-League on Wednesday due to lower left leg muscle soreness.
Tiago Splitter will miss at least six more weeks with a right calf strain.
Rondae Hollis-Jefferson (hip) is listed as questionable for Friday's game vs. Cleveland.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) will not play Friday vs. Cleveland.
James Young (right ankle sprain) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Sixers.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not suit up for Tuesday's game against the Jazz.
ESPN's Charlotte Hornets blog is reporting that Nicolas Batum will miss 1-2 weeks after injuring his right knee on Thursday night.
Cody Zeller (concussion protocol) is out for Thursday's game against the Pistons.
Denzel Valentine (ankle) will not play Saturday vs. the Raptors.
Kevin Love (illness) participated in shootaround Friday morning and will play on Friday night vs. the Nets.
Kyrie Irving (hamstring) is probable for Friday night's game in Brooklyn.
In part of the Kyle Korver trade, Mike Dunleavy Jr. will likely moving onto a third team through Atlanta, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of The Vertical.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
J.J. Barea (Achilles) remains out for Thursday and has a chance to play on Saturday.
Nikola Jokic (illness) is questionable for Saturday's game against the Thunder.
Kenneth Faried (back) is questionable to play against the Thunder on Saturday.
Michael Gbinije (left forearm) is listed as out on Tuesday vs. the Pacers.
Aron Baynes (ankle) will not play against the Hornets on Thursday.
Reggie Bullock (knee) returned to practice on Wednesday.
Klay Thompson (illness) is questionable for Friday against the Grizzlies.
The Rockets have confirmed that Clint Capela has a small fracture in his left fibula and will be re-evaluated in approximately four weeks.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) has not yet been cleared for full practice and still does not yet have a timetable for his return.
Coach Doc Rivers told reporters that Chris Paul will "most likely" play Friday night in Sacramento.
Blake Griffin underwent successful arthroscopic right knee surgery on Tuesday, and his timetable to return has been set at 4-6 weeks.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
Luol Deng (biceps) is questionable for Friday's game vs. Miami.
Larry Nance (knee) did some work on a weight-bearing treadmill on Thursday.
JaMychal Green (face) is listed as out for Friday's game vs. the Warriors.
Chandler Parsons (rest) will not play against the Clippers on Wednesday.
Deyonta Davis suffered a torn plantar fascia and will miss 6-8 weeks.
Brandan Wright underwent arthroscopic ankle surgery on Tuesday and is out indefinitely.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Hassan Whiteside (eye) is listed as out for Friday's game vs. the Lakers.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Matthew Dellavedova (right hamstring strain) is listed as doubtful for Friday night's game vs. the Knicks.
Rashad Vaughn (left ankle sprain) said he's likely going to be out a "couple of weeks."
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Donatas Motiejunas will not play on Thursday against the Hawks.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Kristaps Porzingis (Achilles) participated in shootaround and is expected to return to the Knicks lineup Friday night in Milwaukee, with a possible minutes restriction.
Cameron Payne scored 14 points in the D-League on Wednesday.
Robert Covington (back) has been upgraded from questionable to probable for Friday's game vs. the Celtics.
Joel Embiid (gastroenteritis) was able to participate in shootaround and has been upgraded to probable for Friday's game vs. Boston
Sergio Rodriguez (left ankle sprain) has been downgraded from probable to questionable for Friday's game vs. Boston.
Gerald Henderson (hip) is still listed as probable for Friday's game vs. Boston.
The 76ers have recalled Richaun Holmes (concussion) from the D-League.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
76ers coach Brett Brown said Ben Simmons is "coming along fine."
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.
Rudy Gay (hip) says he will play Friday night vs. the Clippers.
Patrick Patterson (strained left knee) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game vs. the Bulls.
Jared Sullinger (foot) was getting shots up before Thursday's game against the Jazz.
Delon Wright (shoulder) is back to doing on-court work.
George Hill (concussion) will not play Thursday vs. Toronto.
With Ian Mahinmi (knees) expected to miss at least six weeks, Wizards coach Scott Brooks said he will "definitely" consider more small-ball lineups.
Danuel House (wrist) suffered a fractured right wrist.
